author: rufusg.
content: <@354681205842771973> <@636289909359116290>   Thinking about block builders post-merge. I was wondering if you had any insight on why eithermine decided to run their own Mev relay instead of using flashbots? Was FB taking a cut of the fees?

author: chris2_2_2
content: <@97774605351010304>  ask butta. I don’t think fb takes a fee yet

author: alexssd7fp
content: AFAIK Ethermine uses both Flashbots and private relay

author: itsfcl
content: has anyone tried to compare the ratio of ssz/rlp against something like fse/zstd?

author: pietjepuk
content: Ratio of what? The former two are serialization formats, not compression methods.

author: rufusg.
content: Interesting. Seems like a lot of work to make you own relay with no gain? Oh well…

author: alexssd7fp
content: Trust me it’s 10 minutes of work or even less

author: alexssd7fp
content: I think he talks about the overhead of data serialization.

author: pietjepuk
content: Would be an interesting way to ask that question, but I think they just got some things mixed up. Will know if they ever pop back in here

author: treyzania
content: RLP has some features to encode, say, a sequence of 32 0 bytes, or iirc the SHA-3 hash of the empty string

author: treyzania
content: so you could say it has some "compressing functionality", but not like a general purpose compression algo
